title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.31 | 08-02-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chaksharun Militam Yena Tasvai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhigaura Bhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam
Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we are discussing from the 31st verse of the 16th chapter of the 1st canto of Shri Madbhagavatam
Atmanam Chanu Shochami Bhavantam Chamarottamam
Devan Pitrin Rishin Sadhun Sarvan Varanam Stathashraman
The meaning of this 31st verse is as follows
I am thinking about myself and also, O best amongst the demigods, about you
as well as about all the demigods
sages, denizens of Pitraloka, devotees of the Lord
and all men obedient to the system of Varana and Ashrama in human society
These are words spoken by Dharini, Mother Earth, in the shape of a cow
to Dharma, the personality of religious principles, in the shape of a bull
So, what is Dharini telling?
She is thinking about herself
and even about dharma
and all the devatas, the rishis, the pitris, the Vaishnavas, the devotees
about all the people, she is thinking
What about their condition, their position?
So, in the purport, Srila Prabhupada says
something like this
So, in the purport, Srila Prabhupada says something about the cooperation that is required between
different personalities forever, even our basic existence
Srila Prabhupada says in the purport
to effect the perfection of human life
there is cooperation between men and demigods
sages, denizens of Pitraloka, devotees of the Lord and
sages, denizens of Pitraloka, devotees of the Lord and
the sages and presentee are like a fire and a tool
so, when you are in magor and puja
and you can become one with each other
much√≠simas gracias
the scientific system of Varna and ashrama of life
what is Varna ashrama, Varna
means the social divisions according to the occupation
So the brahmanas work in one way they are intellectuals
then
the
sages
the denizens of Pitraloka
all of them
they have to cooperate
for perfection of human life
because they are all different controllers
and have different types of control
exercised over the human beings on the earth
so Srila Prabhupada says
in the purport further
the distinction between human life and animal life
therefore begins with the scientific system
of Varna and Ashrama
guided by the experience of the sages
in relation with the demigods
gradually rising to the summit of reestablishment
our eternal relation with the supreme absolute truth
the personality of Godhead
so
the scriptures describe this
that there are four activities
which are common for human beings and animals
the demands of the body
ahara nidra bhaya maithunam
the demands of the body
the necessity of food
necessity of sleep or rest in the afternoon
and
and at night also
and
the
necessity of the body
in terms of defense
protecting oneself
and
mating

the necessity of ah
sex life for procreation
the necessity of sex life for procreation
so these four are common activities between animals and human beings
but there is a fifth activity
and that's called dharma
and without dharma a human being is
on the level of animals
living a life on the level of animals
dharma viheen apadabha
dharma viheen apadabha
dharma viheen apadabha
this is the statement of the Shastra so therefore human life
means there has to be the scientific system of Varna and ashrama guided by
the experience of the sages in relation with the devatas gradually rising to the
perfection of human life when one is able to re-establish one's Lord's lost
connection with Krishna so when God made Varna ashrama Dharma Krishna says in the
Bhagavad Gita chaturvaranyam maya-srishtam guna-karma-vibhagasaham
so this God made Varna ashrama dharma which is strictly meant for developing
animal consciousness into human consciousness
you can see that in the Bhagavad Gita there is a verse in the Bhagavad Gita that says,
So this God made Varna ashrama Dharma which is strictly meant for developing animal consciousness into human consciousness
and human consciousness into godly consciousness levels of advancement for
human beings from animal consciousness to human consciousness by following the
Varna ashrama Dharma and from human conscious to godly consciousness by
following the teachings of the Bhagavad Gita by following the teachings of the
bhagavatam like that
and in this way when one makes actual factual spiritual advancement then one

can very easily understand who am I who is God what is my relationship etc so this arrangement of the Bhagavad Gita which is strictly meant for developing animal consciousness into human consciousness by following the teachings of the Bhagavad Gita by following the teachings of the bhagavatam like that
the ultimate of the supreme Lord for a human society of Varna ashrama Dharma is broken by advancement of foolishness
that means people don't properly understand the purpose of this varnashrama they criticize they
give trouble they challenge the authority etc so such disturbance in the human society in the
name of following some varnashrama but actually not in proper spirit the system of progressive
life becomes at once disturbed so Prabhupada says in Kali Yuga the first attack of the venomous snake
strikes against God made varnashrama this God made varnashrama is almost destroyed
by the influence of the Kali Yuga and a person properly qualified as a
Brahmana is treated like a shudra in Kali Yuga and a shudra by qualification such a
person is passing off as a Brahmana and what is the basis oh I was born in a Brahmana family
or somebody else is not born in a Brahmana family so these are all not the proper understanding of
the Shastra so proper understanding of the Shastra means by birth there is no consideration of
somebody being belonging to Brahmana Kshatriya Vaishal Shudra Varanasa
so this has to be understood carefully that birth is not the criterion though Srila Prabhupada says
that if somebody is born in a good Brahmana family they have very good opportunity to get
trained up as a Brahmana right from the early stages of your life but they are not the criteria
for their birth so this has to be understood carefully that birth is not the criterion though Shri
their life but even if we don't consider this consideration of birth or
consideration of occupational duties we don't consider that but simply a person
develops control of the mind control of the senses and cultivates tolerance
simplicity cleanliness knowledge truthfulness devotion and faith in the
Supreme then one becomes a really qualified Brahmana and in the present
age the influence of Kali is such that people
neglect the knowledge of the Supreme.
to follow the proper culture and they become victim of the age of Kali they
become victim of the age of Kali so due to this age of Kali the influence of the
age everything is topsy-turvy
especially as regards varnashrama it's topsy-turvy we don't have qualified
Brahmanas we don't have qualified Kshatriyas we don't have very much
qualified Vaishyas some Vaishyas are there but not very qualified and the
influence of the Kali also makes people corrupt they are not straightforward they are not

inclined to know more about transcendence so this being the atmosphere the whole condition is so bad on the earth planet that mother earth was lamenting the regret regrettable condition of this earth planet before the appearance of Krishna so I'll stop here thank you.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna
